page.title: 14The M9 M/Way Stirling(contd)
page.content: Over 100 lorries pass by in half an hour, and about{60}vans, especially at the end of the week. Private coaches use the M9 daily, but there are more in the summer with tours. On market days cattlefloats use it as it is a convenient and quick route for farmers in Central Region. The percentage of motor bikes using it is much lower than other vehicles. It is also a quick route for police and fire engines in case of accidents. On average most of the traffic is northbound, as this will eventually meet the{A9}for the north of Scotland. The M9 is most definately a busy and essential motorway for any driver as it cuts down mileage and saves time.
